p: In addition to typical causes of encephalitis, travel-related causes are arboviruses (e.g., West Nile virus, Japanese encephalitis, tick-borne encephalitis), brucellosis, rabies, rickettsial infections, African trypanosomiasis, and tuberculosis. African trypanosomiasis (sleeping sickness) has been described in travelers returning from game parks in East and Central Africa, including Tanzania, Malawi, and Zambia.
